    • Method Detail

      • send_json_post_request

        @When(value="^send json post request (.*?)$")
public void send_json_post_request(java.lang.String name)
        Triggers http post request with json body. Content of the body comes from the file.
        ValidatableResponse is available as a context Object with name response.

        Uses following objects:
        scenarioCtx.response
        Environment.REST_url
        Environment.Rest_url_post_path
        Parameters:
        name, - String, name of the template that contains http body of the request

      • send_xml_post_request_with_soap_action_header

        @When(value="^send xml post request (.*?) with soap action header (.*?)$")
public void send_xml_post_request_with_soap_action_header(java.lang.String name,
                                                                                                                                      java.lang.String actionHeader)
        Triggers http post request with xml body (soap). Content of the body comes from the file.
        ValidatableResponse is available as a context Object with name response.

        Uses following objects:
        scenarioCtx.response
        Environment.REST_url
        Parameters:
        name, - String, name of the template that contains http body of the request
        actionHeader, - String, soap action that will be set in the header

      • service_is_available

        @Given(value="^service is available$")
public void service_is_available()
        Verifies that service is available
        This is just a sanity check.
        It triggers GET request towards defined url
        It checks that http response code is 200 (OK)

        Uses following objects:
        Expected.statusOK
        env.REST_url

      • verify_that_response_has

        @Then(value="^verify that rest response body has$")
public void verify_that_response_has(java.util.List<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> table)
        Verifies that particular key xml/json body response contains expected value
        Multiple different comparisons can be executed. Following actions are supported
        equalTo, containsString, containsInAnyOrder, greaterThan, lessThan
        Parameters:
        table, - DataTable, it shall contains 3 columns key, action, expected

      • verify_that_status_code_is

        @Then(value="^verify that status code is (.+)$")
public void verify_that_status_code_is(java.lang.String input)
        Verifies that response status code is {}

        Uses following objects:
        scenarioCtx.response
        Parameters:
        input - status code or value from storage
